page.title: 13 Plantations
page.content: In our square we have four plantations and two coppices. Timber is grown to be used for lots of things like houses, furniture, boxes, wagons, road vehicles, telegraph poles, railway sleepers, farm garden or shipyard fencing. Wood is used for other purposes, tool making, toy making, brush making, and the bare bones of musical instruments. Our newspapers are made from pulp which starts of as wood. Lots of paper items are made from wood-pulp, such as paper, writing paper, and newspaper. Trees grown in these plantations are mostly Douglas_Fir, Scots pine, and Spruce. Some plantations are owned by the forestry commision, a government organization, and some are privately owned.
